body_html:
I'm able to replicate the problem with a single call to GRUCell:

c = GRUCell(5)
init = c.zero_state(tf.size(num_words), tf.float32)
outs = c(word_embeds[:,0,:], init)
# reinitialize variables
av = sess.run(outs, {line:a})    
bv = sess.run(outs, {line:b})    
abv = sess.run(outs, {line:ab})

to get:

In [63]: av[0] - abv[0][0]
Out[63]: 
array([[ -2.23517418e-08,   8.94069672e-08,  -2.60770321e-08,
          7.45058060e-08,   0.00000000e+00]], dtype=float32)

etc.

perhaps we are compiling FAST_MATH, and as a result the fp32 matmul or nonlinearities (tanh/sigmoid) are returning different values along the vectorisation path? @rmlarsen what do you think?

body:
I'm able to replicate the problem with a single call to GRUCell:

```
c = GRUCell(5)
init = c.zero_state(tf.size(num_words), tf.float32)
outs = c(word_embeds[:,0,:], init)
# reinitialize variables
av = sess.run(outs, {line:a})    
bv = sess.run(outs, {line:b})    
abv = sess.run(outs, {line:ab})  
```

to get:
```
In [63]: av[0] - abv[0][0]
Out[63]: 
array([[ -2.23517418e-08,   8.94069672e-08,  -2.60770321e-08,
          7.45058060e-08,   0.00000000e+00]], dtype=float32)
```

etc.

perhaps we are compiling FAST_MATH, and as a result the fp32 matmul or nonlinearities (tanh/sigmoid) are returning different values along the vectorisation path?  @rmlarsen what do you think?
